data.title: After to open godot: application frozen and without response using jack2
data.body:
# Device

| OS | GODOT | DE | LINUX |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Manjaro Linux | 2.1 | XFCE | 4.7.5-1 |
# Description

After open the godot the windows stay unresponsive and seems nothing can be done here. The `-debug` flag just doesn't works too :(.

I use `strace` to get the stack dataflow, that is the log: http://sprunge.us/jKUB
# How to reproduce
1. Install `jack2-dbus`
2. Run `jack_control start`
3. Run `godot`
   ![bug](http://i.imgur.com/BfnhkiA.png)

Any thoughts?

data.title: Nodepath Assign use absolute path when many nodes are selected and assigned
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description:**
When the user has multiple nodes with an export var of NodePath type and try to assign **two or more** at the same time, the assigned value is an absolute one of type:
"/root/EditorNode/@@4/@@5/@@9/@@11/@@15/@@19/@@20/@@21/@@37/@@38/@@40/@@41/@@8585/@@8475/@@8476/@@8477/@@8478/@@8479/stage/paths/pattern_5/pattern_5_trigger"
The value should be a relative one, if the user select and assign only one NodePath, the value is assigned as relative ("../../paths/pattern_5/pattern_5_trigger").
This issue break the has_node/get_node which return false/error with the "/root/EditorNode/..." path 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a script with this export line:
`export(NodePath) var path`
add this script to two or more nodes
Try to assign the path value from the script with two or more nodes selected

Here is a video of the steps:
https://gfycat.com/FarflungHonorableArabianwildcat

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
The project from the video:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/3e346ng6n88zji2/nodepath_issue.zip

data.title: Expose more 2D/3D physics options in project settings (#5029)
data.body:
This PR fix #5029 :
- Expose default gravity, gravity vector, linear damp, and angular damp for 3D
- Expose sleep parameters for 2D and 3D
- Remove all calls to `space_set_param` from World2D constructor, now those parameters are set in Space2DSW constructor (`space_2d_sw.cpp`). The 3D counterpart already did this.

NOTE:
There was a difference between default values defined in `space_2d_sw.cpp` and those defined in `world_2d.cpp`. I used those in `world_2d.cpp` because they were actually being applied.

data.title: Reordering scripts
data.body:
We should be able to sort the scripts as we please.

![](http://i.imgur.com/hyEqmPp.png)

Currently, we cannot change the ordering of the scripts. 
I wish for the ability to (ctrl+up/ ctrl+down) reorder the scripts in order to organize them better, in a similar way we can with nodes in tree view.

So it's come to my attention that the way godot updates is rather....clunky in terms of needing to go onto the site and download it repeatedly for every update

is it possible to add a functionallity or something to the engine perhaps on the projects menu where it'll scan for an update, then you have the option to click if you want to update and it'll get the files and update godot to the latest version?

(just an idea for something to add to the 2.2/3.0 release)

data.title: Properly encode InputEvent of type NONE. Fix #5987
data.body:
In the editor settings you can disable default editor shortcuts.
When a default shortcut is disabled an InputEvent of type NONE must
be stored in the config file to allow the editor to remember that setting.
variant_parser.cpp was not properly encoding InputEvent of type NONE causing
the "corruption" of the editor settings file. (Fix #5987 )

P.S.: Hacktoberfest has started :beers:

data.title: Mesh VisibilityInstance layers value not preserved on .duplicate()
data.body:
I'm running Godot 2.1 on Windows 8.

After setting up a basic scene, I set the camera to only display a specific 'Visible Layer', and set the only mesh in the scene to display on a specific 'VisibilityInstance Layer'. 

After I translate the mesh, I .duplicate() it, but the duplicate does not appear on the same layer. I can only see the new duplicated mesh if I set the camera to display the default visible layer. 

I suspect that means that duplicated meshes lose VisibilityInstance layer settings...

Can this be confirmed?

data.title: baked light baker : improves randomness
data.body:
**edit :** as mentioned into #6682, Reduz said on IRC that he will rewrite the baker for 3.x.
- For the time being, this PR can be merged as is into custom 2.x version to fixes the multi-threaded baking bug and to standardize the baking quality and accuracy among platforms (`rand()` implementation is not standardized and not multi-thread safe).
- Other than that, this PR can also be used to evaluate the actual influence of different PRNG over the quality and the speed of the baking process. If you find that a PRNG gives better or worst results than others, please, share your findings with us.

---

see #6682

replace `rand()` by a thread-safe and thread-seeded RNG.

------ edit ----------

So I've put different algorithms that can be easily changed at compile time by defining one of these preprocessor variable :

```
BAKER_RNG_USE_C_RAND
BAKER_RNG_USE_XONOROSHI128PLUS
BAKER_RNG_USE_XORSHIFT128
BAKER_RNG_USE_XORSHIFTSTAR
BAKER_RNG_USE_XORSHIFTPLUS
BAKER_RNG_USE_MT19937
BAKER_RNG_USE_CXX11_MT19937
BAKER_RNG_USE_XORSHIFT32
```

Some are more optimized for 64bits, some others for 32bits.
Some are more optimized for MSVC, some others for GCC.
Some have relatively low periodicity, some others relatively higher one.

Default is set to BAKER_RNG_USE_MT19937.

note : 
- BAKER_RNG_USE_C_RAND is the default `rand()`.
  It is guaranteed to be multithread-safe only with MSVC.
  It is slightly faster than others RNG, but it has a RAND_MAX of only 0x7FFF, is based on an unknown underlying algorithm with an unknown periodicity.
- BAKER_RNG_USE_CXX11_MT19937 is the standard C++11 std::mt19937.
  It is still experimental on GCC 4.6.3, and is fully supported by MSVC.

data.title: notes about the baked light baker of godot 2.1
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
godot 2.1

**Purpose of this post:**

As mentioned by @reduz on IRC, the Baked-Light Baker will be rewritten for 3.x.

Though, some of us might be willing to share their findings about current implementation and discuss them.
This is the purpose of this post.

Note :
On IRC @reduz said he wanted to make some changes to the baker :
1) drop geometry and only do collision against the octree
2) keep track of how much light entered from each side of the cube to avoid the current bleeding problems
3) do everything in GPU

---

My today's findings about current implementation :
( tested with a godot version 2.x win64 compiled with MSVC 2015 )

**about `rand()` and multi-thread :**

Current implementation of the baker makes use of `rand()` :
- I've found that each threads will generate the same random numbers, and thus will throw the same rays.
- It tends to create cloudy-noisy patterns that never really get smoothed.
- I read everywhere that `rand()` and `srand()` are not thread-safe.
- on some implementation `RAND_MAX` is limited to 32768. (this is the case with MSVC2015)

So,
I've replaced `rand()` with a RNG from the standard c++11 `random` library ([`#include <random>`](http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/random/mt19937/)) : 
- each thread has its own RNG which is seeded with a 100% random seed.
- noisy-cloudy patterns are smoothed faster
- the `RAND_MAX` is unsigned 2^32

(i'll publish the patch later)

Here are two screenshots to compare.
**Top** is standard `rand()`, **bottom** is thread seeded `std::mt19937` RNG.

Both are baked for 15 minutes at around 201.500 rays/s on 3 threads ( Editor Settings / Light Baker / Custom Bake Threads = 3 ), and a plot size of 2.5.

![baked_light_baker_c_rand](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/19022379/cfe8e80c-88d7-11e6-8926-6c64c1021c7d.png)

![baked_light_baker_mt_rand](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/19022380/d583a572-88d7-11e6-94c8-7365108483d5.png)

data.title: Building AppImages for Godot editor and (maybe) games
data.body:
It would be awesome if [AppImages](http://appimage.org/) could be created for the Godot editor (for distribution of official or unofficial builds) and maybe exported games.

The goal of AppImages is to make portable Linux binaries easy. No dependencies need to be installed for users; think of it as macOS' .app, but for Linux, it's essentially an application bundle which can also provide basic system integration (such as menus and icons).
## What needs to be done
- Gather a list of all required libraries that are not linked statically to Godot. This can be figured out using `ldd` for example. [Beware as some libraries should never be included in an AppImage.](https://github.com/probonopd/AppImages/blob/master/excludelist)
- Automate the creation of editor AppImages using SCons (or shell scripts). For this, a template AppDir must be created first, and put in the Godot Git repository (just like the macOS template). A script should be provided for copying system libraries to the AppDir.
- Document the AppImage creation process.
- Provide official AppImages as the recommended way of running Godot on Linux, for 64-bit and 32-bit. Some instructions should be provided as well (users still need to `chmod +x` them).
## Additional tasks
- What should be done for games? I don't think it's feasible to export AppImages from a non-Linux system, but this needs to be confirmed. Perhaps we can provide a script that converts a Linux export to an AppImage.
## Resources
- [Documentation on creating AppImages](https://github.com/probonopd/AppImageKit#creating-appimages)

data.title: Shadows misplaced when spotlight is arbitrarly oriented
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot current version - Linux x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It appears tht the shadows cast from a spotlight are misplaced when the spotlight is not aligned with any axis:

![screenshot](https://scontent-lhr3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/14449719_10209566929843032_8807087403038682044_n.jpg?oh=b643f828c9d8692657c0e46875455a1c&oe=58AADE55)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a plane mesh on the xz plane
- Create a spotlight that points to the plane from above but with an angle with respect to the y axis
- Crate an object and put the object on the plane in a place lit by the spotlight

data.title: [Suggestion] - Option to choose entire folder and subdirectory for export
data.body:
![1234](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/19019491/e785fd5e-883e-11e6-87a9-672bf148d809.png)

I have hundreds of gd scripts and other files that need to have their own .pck file (for patching later, etc) -- We cannot hold down shift + select multiple files either.  I am suggesting an option to select an entire folder and all its children and sub-directories to be exported! Would be a great quality of life feature!

data.title: ConvertTo TileSet file extension options not matching acceptable extensions during Tile Set loading
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot Engine v2.2.alpha.custom_build

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you click on Scene -> Convert To... -> TileSet... you get 3 options: *.tres, *.res and *.xml.
When you want to load a TileSet, it only accepts *.tres and *.xml, but not *.res.

We should be able to load .res files or it should be removed as an option when converting to TileSet :)

data.title: queue_free crashing physics server
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux (Arch) x64 - Godot master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When using `queue_free` in `_integrate_forces` or anywhere else on a RigidBody2D/KinematicBody2D (even if it is set to MODE_STATIC, with layer/collision mask == 0), the game would crash from time to time... seemingly without reason. This is pretty much a blocker for "me", since it makes bullets nearly impossible to do properly.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run https://github.com/KOBUGE-Incubator/ringed (https://github.com/KOBUGE-Incubator/ringed/commit/7fecca7fb54c8635cb30ea83fe13440c4b488e9a in case something changes), and start shooting.. at some point in time, the game would crash (you might have to die a few zillion times before, but it is granted to happen). Now, retry with an older version, and see it doesn't happen there (good luck :wink:)

**GDB backtraces:**

```
#0  0x00000000015e655c in Space2DSW::get_body_angular_velocity_sleep_treshold (this=0x0) at servers/physics_2d/space_2d_sw.h:162
#1  0x00000000015e4c63 in Body2DSW::sleep_test (this=0x5b99040, p_step=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/body_2d_sw.cpp:642
#2  0x00000000015ee3e2 in Step2DSW::_check_suspend (this=0x341c270, p_island=0x5b99040, p_delta=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/step_2d_sw.cpp:110
#3  0x00000000015eeacc in Step2DSW::step (this=0x341c270, p_space=0x3946120, p_delta=0.0166666675, p_iterations=8) at servers/physics_2d/step_2d_sw.cpp:308
#4  0x00000000015da3f5 in Physics2DServerSW::step (this=0x34204e0, p_step=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/physics_2d_server_sw.cpp:1277
#5  0x0000000001664df5 in Physics2DServerWrapMT::step (this=0x7fffe8265030, p_step=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/physics_2d_server_wrap_mt.cpp:86
#6  0x00000000004327bf in Main::iteration () at main/main.cpp:1587
#7  0x0000000000416311 in OS_X11::run (this=0x7fffffffe020) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:1921
#8  0x000000000040e9f0 in main (argc=1, argv=0x7fffffffe538) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:41
```

Or:

```
#0  0x00000000015edbfb in Comparator<Constraint2DSW*>::operator() (this=0x7fffffffd927, p_a=@0x7fffffffd9b0: 0x4acb980, p_b=@0xc4a3b5dc00000030: <error reading variable>)
    at core/typedefs.h:268
#1  0x00000000015ed40c in Map<Constraint2DSW*, int, Comparator<Constraint2DSW*>, DefaultAllocator>::_find (this=0x52d7960, p_key=@0x7fffffffd9b0: 0x4acb980) at core/map.h:248
#2  0x00000000015ed072 in Map<Constraint2DSW*, int, Comparator<Constraint2DSW*>, DefaultAllocator>::find (this=0x52d7960, p_key=@0x7fffffffd9b0: 0x4acb980) at core/map.h:560
#3  0x00000000015eceeb in Map<Constraint2DSW*, int, Comparator<Constraint2DSW*>, DefaultAllocator>::operator[] (this=0x52d7960, p_key=@0x7fffffffd9b0: 0x4acb980) at core/map.h:627
#4  0x00000000015eccdd in Body2DSW::add_constraint (this=0x52d77f0, p_constraint=0x4acb980, p_pos=1) at servers/physics_2d/body_2d_sw.h:188
#5  0x000000000168bb42 in BodyPair2DSW::BodyPair2DSW (this=0x4acb980, p_A=0x42f18a0, p_shape_A=0, p_B=0x52d77f0, p_shape_B=0) at servers/physics_2d/body_pair_2d_sw.cpp:537
#6  0x00000000016868b6 in Space2DSW::_broadphase_pair (A=0x42f18a0, p_subindex_A=0, B=0x52d77f0, p_subindex_B=0, p_self=0x3945f90) at servers/physics_2d/space_2d_sw.cpp:1129
#7  0x000000000167bcfc in BroadPhase2DHashGrid::_check_motion (this=0x3911fc0, p_elem=0x41c1398) at servers/physics_2d/broad_phase_2d_hash_grid.cpp:89
#8  0x000000000167cd82 in BroadPhase2DHashGrid::move (this=0x3911fc0, p_id=2793, p_aabb=...) at servers/physics_2d/broad_phase_2d_hash_grid.cpp:384
#9  0x00000000015e88c4 in CollisionObject2DSW::_update_shapes (this=0x42f18a0) at servers/physics_2d/collision_object_2d_sw.cpp:158
#10 0x00000000015e54f8 in CollisionObject2DSW::_set_transform (this=0x42f18a0, p_transform=..., p_update_shapes=true) at servers/physics_2d/collision_object_2d_sw.h:80
#11 0x00000000015e47f1 in Body2DSW::integrate_velocities (this=0x42f18a0, p_step=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/body_2d_sw.cpp:562
#12 0x00000000015eea86 in Step2DSW::step (this=0x341c170, p_space=0x3945f90, p_delta=0.0166666675, p_iterations=8) at servers/physics_2d/step_2d_sw.cpp:298
#13 0x00000000015da3f5 in Physics2DServerSW::step (this=0x34203e0, p_step=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/physics_2d_server_sw.cpp:1277
#14 0x0000000001664df5 in Physics2DServerWrapMT::step (this=0x7fffe8265030, p_step=0.0166666675) at servers/physics_2d/physics_2d_server_wrap_mt.cpp:86
#15 0x00000000004327bf in Main::iteration () at main/main.cpp:1587
#16 0x0000000000416311 in OS_X11::run (this=0x7fffffffe020) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:1921
#17 0x000000000040e9f0 in main (argc=1, argv=0x7fffffffe538) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:41
```

Or:

```
#0  0x0000000001687290 in CollisionObject2DSW::get_type (this=0x13e013600) at servers/physics_2d/collision_object_2d_sw.h:98
#1  0x0000000001686734 in Space2DSW::_broadphase_pair (A=0x461f640, p_subindex_A=0, B=0x13e013600, p_subindex_B=-1057153242, p_self=0x3945ed0) at servers/physics_2d/space_2d_sw.cpp:1099
[didn't save rest :/]
```

**Bisect output:**

```
$ git bisect log
git bisect start 'servers'
# bad: [dabcabe9815612c7ef1c99909b14d632f13df165] Merge pull request #6658 from Faless/fix_bo_network
git bisect bad dabcabe9815612c7ef1c99909b14d632f13df165
# good: [9e2b9f8cb1c34fe7c3aa91bdd7f40ebb6a1a318f] bump to stable, congratulations everyone
git bisect good 9e2b9f8cb1c34fe7c3aa91bdd7f40ebb6a1a318f
# good: [64b4253dbfe3fdfc4efa405086d23765a9774d91] changed visual server free() to free_rid() like in the other servers. Fixes #4917
git bisect good 64b4253dbfe3fdfc4efa405086d23765a9774d91
# bad: [3725114a1658337d6de21bb7a5b6fde5f8a74d1f] Merge pull request #5383 from Ovnuniarchos/OptimizeOneWay
git bisect bad 3725114a1658337d6de21bb7a5b6fde5f8a74d1f
# bad: [b4b80625d175a151f05403c9dcbc5f13be652289] Change hash grid in 2D physics to contemplate large objects as separate cases, to avoid huge memory and performance penalty. Fixes #4662
git bisect bad b4b80625d175a151f05403c9dcbc5f13be652289
# good: [b7dbf9207abf9fb9e4cc46e8e1d67f3d6d40d58c] Drop empty files that are not used anywhere
git bisect good b7dbf9207abf9fb9e4cc46e8e1d67f3d6d40d58c
# good: [c3bf11d4d48c0499460dc294c6836acedbfd46cb] Drop fully commented-out files
git bisect good c3bf11d4d48c0499460dc294c6836acedbfd46cb
# first bad commit: [b4b80625d175a151f05403c9dcbc5f13be652289] Change hash grid in 2D physics to contemplate large objects as separate cases, to avoid huge memory and performance penalty. Fixes #4662
```

(I might have done something wrong with the bisect, since some of the good might be bad, or some of the bad might be some other bug...)

Anyway. it seems like b4b80625d175a151f05403c9dcbc5f13be652289 is the culprit here, though I have no idea why...

data.title: Double clicking a node in the Scene tab doesn't always register to rename it.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.2 alpha (September 30th)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When double clicking a node in the Scene tab the node will be centered in the 2D or 3D panel, and it wont open the dialog to change the node's name. I have to double click it again, and even then sometimes it doesn't register. Sometimes I have to double click several times before it will let me change the node name. Double clicking should only be used to rename a node, not to center it in the view, we can already press the "F" key to focus on the selected node. And as far as I can tell there's no shortcut or button in the right click menu of a node to rename it, so double clicking is the only way.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to double click a node in the Scene tab.

data.title: Subclass automatically calls parent's _ready()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It's easier to just read the screenshot, pay attention to the Output tab...
The parent's _ready() are called automatically, even when the subclass' didn't call it. Not sure if bug or working as intended.
![error1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14923217/19014479/4297baf8-8820-11e6-9af2-f3ae0c4d8ff7.png)

data.title: AnimationPlayer node cannot call functions defined in a singleton
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux 16.04 64b, Godot version f30602c67a86bce393c5e67551755e0a8b3f0dd4

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Apparently it's not possible to call functions defined in a singleton from a call func track in an animation.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a call to a singleton in a call func track, for example "main.testfunc" with no arguments or anything. 
Nothing happens. No error is returned either. Apparently even if the singleton is removed later, nothing happens either, instead of throwing an error, meaning if you type the singleton's name wrong, there will be no warning either.

data.title: Save All Button in code editor does nothing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro x64
Godot 2.1 stable x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Using the Save All in the code editor does not save any files

**Steps to reproduce:**
edit any script file, then use the save all button in the script editor.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
